summary: Whole bacterial cells containing stereospecific amidases were used to achieve high enantiomeric excess (ee) values for the production of (S)-piperazine-2-carboxylic acid and (R)-piperidine-2-carboxylic acid.
key_claims: Klebsiella terrigena DSM 9174 produced (S)-piperazine-2-carboxylic acid with an ee value of 99.4% and a yield of 41%
Burkholderia sp. DSM 9925 produced (R)-piperazine-2-carboxylic acid with an ee value of 99.0% and a yield of 22%
Pseudomonas fluorescens DSM 9924 produced (S)-piperidine-2-carboxylic acid with an ee value of 97.3% and a yield of 20%

media: growth media containing one of the racemic carboxamides as sole nitrogen source

_title: Preparation of (S)-piperazine-2-carboxylic acid, (R)-piperazine-2-carboxylic acid, and (S)-piperidine-2-carboxylic acid by kinetic resolution of the corresponding racemic carboxamides with stereoselective amidases in whole bacterial cells
_abstract: Whole bacterial cells containing stereospecific amidases were used for the kinetic resolution of racemic piperazine-2-carboxamide and piperidine-2-carboxamide to (S)and (R)-piperazine-2-carboxylic acid, and (S)-piperidine-2-carboxylic acid, respectively. (S)-Piperazinecarboxylic acid dihydrochloride produced with the biocatalysts Klebsiella terrigena DSM 9174 had an ee value of 99.4% (41% yield), and the ee value of (R)piperazinecarboxylic acid dihydrochloride obtained with Burkholderia sp. DSM 9925 was 99.0% (22% yield). Using Pseudomonas fluorescens DSM 9924 (S)-piperidine-2carboxylic acid with an ee value of 97.3% (20% yield) was isolated.
